Why Families Choose Hospice and Palliative Care of California

We provide hospice care that honors the needs, values, and preferences of each individual and their family. Our team takes time to understand the person beyond the illness by learning daily rhythms, sources of comfort, and what brings a sense of calm, so care feels personal, respectful, and supportive. We listen closely, work in collaboration with families and physicians, and shape care around the details that help create steadiness and reassurance during this time.

Support is always available. Our hospice team offers 24/7 on-call support for questions, concerns, or urgent needs, while in-home visits are thoughtfully scheduled based on the individual’s care plan and evolving needs. Through clear communication and consistent coordination, we remain a steady source of support, ensuring care is always within reach.

Feel free to contact our team for questions, guidance, or resources. Reaching out does not require any commitment. We’re here to support you and understand your options.

A Peaceful Path with Hospice Care

Hospice care is not a withdrawal of care, but a transition to holistic support that prioritizes comfort, pain relief, and emotional well-being. This approach is designed to ease distress and support daily comfort, allowing individuals to remain as peaceful and supported as possible during this stage of life.

Our experienced and compassionate team understands the weight that often accompanies a terminal illness, not only for the individual, but for their loved ones as well. Through the collaborative efforts of registered and skilled nurses, case managers, social workers, chaplains, and trained volunteers, hospice care is delivered with attentiveness, respect, and sensitivity to each person’s unique needs. Rather than focusing on cure, hospice shifts attention toward comfort, presence, and what matters most to the individual and their family.

Throughout this time, our team helps create a calm and reassuring environment where families can be present with one another and share meaningful moments. Support may include scheduled in-home visits, symptom management, personal care such as grooming, bathing, dressing, and nutrition, emotional and spiritual support, respite care to allow family caregivers time to rest and care for themselves, and volunteer companionship to provide additional comfort and presence.

Care continues beyond a loved one’s passing through grief counseling and compassionate guidance, offering support as families navigate loss and begin the healing process.

Hospice Eligibility and Care Access

Admission to hospice requires physician certification of a terminal illness and consent from the individual or their family. We are committed to providing care with dignity and respect and do not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, disability, age, sex, religion, sexual orientation, or gender identity in admission, treatment, or participation in our programs.

Our Process

Compassionate Hospice Support for Families in Southern California

Whether you're seeking support for yourself or someone you love, we understand how important sensitivity and understanding are in this moment. We listen closely, honor personal wishes, and provide compassionate care that helps ease this transition with the utmost respect, dignity, and reverence for the natural course of life.

1

Meet With Our Care Coordinator

We begin with a warm, supportive conversation to understand the needs of the person receiving care, answer any questions you may have, and explain how hospice can provide comfort during this transition. There is never any obligation to enroll. We are simply here to guide and support you.

2

Create a Personalized Hospice Plan

We collaborate with the individual's physician and family to develop a thoughtful care approach that honors their needs, familiar routines, and personal wishes.

3

Begin Care

Our team of nurses, aides, social workers, chaplains, and therapists provides gentle, expert support focused on comfort, dignity, and companionship. We remain available throughout the journey, so you never have to navigate this alone.

Get in touch with our team

Frequently Asked Questions

What is hospice care?

Hospice focuses on comfort, symptom relief, and quality of life when a cure is no longer possible.

Is hospice covered by Medicare?

Yes. Hospice is fully covered by Medicare, Medi-Cal, and most private insurance plans.

Can hospice be provided at home?

Absolutely. Our team provides complete hospice services in the comfort of your home.

What support do families receive?

We provide hands-on RN/LVN nursing care, medical social work support, respite services, bereavement counseling, and emotional and spiritual care. Our team also offers physical, occupational, and speech therapies to enhance comfort and quality of life. On-call support is available 24/7, and in-home visits are scheduled based on each patient's needs and individualized care plan.

How quickly can care begin?

Most families can start services the same day or within 24 hours.

Our mission is to bring comfort, dignity, and meaningful support to individuals facing serious illness through compassionate end-of-life care. We strive to understand each person's unique needs, honor their values, and walk alongside families with empathy and guidance so every moment can be met with presence, understanding, and peace.

Hospice Care Services and Support

Hospice Physician

Hospice physicians oversee the plan of care, working closely with the care team to ensure comfort, symptom management, and continuity of support. They regularly review the individual’s condition and adjust care as needed to align with changing needs and goals.

RN / LVN Care

Registered Nurses and Licensed Vocational Nurses provide hands-on clinical care, including symptom monitoring, medication management, and ongoing assessments. Their role is to promote comfort, respond to changes, and support both individuals and families with clear guidance and reassurance.

Medical Social Services

Medical social workers support individuals and families through the emotional, practical, and decision-making aspects of hospice care. They offer counseling, resource coordination, and guidance to help families navigate this time with clarity and support.

Chaplain Support

Chaplains provide spiritual and emotional support tailored to each individual’s beliefs and values. They offer presence, reflection, and comfort to both individuals and families throughout the hospice journey.

Hospice Aides

Hospice aides assist with personal care needs such as bathing, grooming, and daily comfort. Their consistent presence helps maintain dignity while supporting day-to-day routines at home.

Volunteer Support

Trained hospice volunteers offer companionship, practical assistance, and emotional presence. Their support provides comfort to individuals and relief to families through meaningful connection and time spent together.

Physical, Occupational, and Speech Therapy

Therapy services focus on comfort, safety, and quality of life. Therapists support mobility, positioning, daily activities, communication, and swallowing as appropriate, helping individuals remain as comfortable and supported as possible.
